criminalRecord:
The only suspect in the bankruptcy and disappearance of a nouveau riche in the council. Attempted to tamper with the subconscious of a dozen people, leading to irreversible and severe damage of their mental state. Opened a clinic while hiding her identity as a Sinner and her psychopathic illness. Suspected of malicious brainwashing hypnosis, causing a threat to society by swaying people's minds.

--

The official involved in the missing of a certain bankrupt new councilor has recently been sentenced to death for multiple crimes including crimes against humanity. The subject's complicated history with the said official can no longer be fully traced. Due to her peculiar interest in mental torture, she's been put under Chief's direct supervision since her detention.

Currently, the subject works as a psychologist in the Bureau and treats all sorts of psychological issues in the Sinners. Her therapy is highly effective and her role is irreplaceable.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary

Able to hypnotize and tamper with people's memories, create mental illusions, and stimulate the unknown potential of all living beings through touch.

+++* Awakening Signs

Awakened before puberty, which was a long time ago from now. The precise awakening signs could not be determined, presumably due to her powers being acquired during a coma after a great shock.

+++* Corruption State

No physical changes were observed. Experience extremely unstable mental state, worsening mental illness, and frequent nightmares. Aromatherapy and medication are required to suppress abnormal behavior.
ecbFlavourText:
"Chameleon, we're not trying to deny your talent."
"But as sharers of other people's secrets, we must be ready to face human nature's rawest malice."
interrogation1:
The [[[Chief]]] interrogates Chameleon about her motives for hypnotizing the four members of the Jacknal Family, each of whom experienced auditory hallucations and attempted suicide. Chameleon fires back, claiming that there is no difference between her hypnosis and the Chief's use of the [[[Shackles]]] on unwilling Sinners. While Chameleon distracts them from the main topic of the interrogation, they become disoriented by the sounds of her pocket watch. After fifteen minutes that pass faster than expected, [[[Nightingale]]] pulls the Chief out of the Interrogation Room. Wandering the halls of the Bureau later, the Chief hallucinates visions of many different Sinners, who accuse them of treating Sinners like dogs or slaves and prying into their painful memories, causing pain just because of their curiosity about the Sinners' pasts. Eventually, the Chief realizes that they are having a nightmare, and reawakens in the Interrogation Room. The Chief Shackles Chameleon, but she shows no fear or hesitation. The Chief then ends the interrogation, ordering Nightingale to put her into solitary confinement under heavy guard and confiscate her pocket watch. Her parting words are that although she and the Chief are the same in causing pain, in these chaotic times, pain may not be a bad thing.

Chameleon didn't directly answer any of the questions regarding the case. Instead, she tried to hypnotize you without your consent in an attempt to break your determination by making you believe that the other Sinners are refusing to cooperate. Her mysterious nature troubles you. It seems another threat is lurking in the dark and waiting for its chance to jump at you.
interrogation2:
The Chief has confused dreams featuring fire, blood, a clock, and a crying girl. When they awake, they instinctively seek out Chameleon, who explains that it was her dream, which the Chief entered somehow via the Shackles' link. She goes on to tell them that as a child, she would hide inside her father's clock cabinet to watch them consult their patients. From this position, she witnessed her parents' murder at the hands of a patient who did not trust that they would keep his secrets. He bashed their heads in with a sculpture of Hypnos, the God of Dreams, and set fire to the office to destroy their records. In order to learn what else the Chief saw in their dream, Chameleon hypnotizes them again, having been faking vulnerability in order to lure the Chief into her trap. The Chief's subconscious world takes the form of an archive, where they see a vision of a shadowly [[[Langley]]], who feels familiar but unrecognizable. At Chameleon's urging, the Chief asks Langley for the whereabouts of a hostage that they had seen in their earlier dream. Langley hands them a document detailing Chameleon's family history and the murder of her parents at the hands of Oris, a self-made man who began as the secretary to a councilor, before marrying into the Jacknal family and becoming a councilor of Paradeisos himself. Ten years after the murders, in N.F. 106, Oris's wife and parents cut ties with him; without the support of his wife's family, he lost his residency in Paradeisos. In N.F. 107, Oris was found hypnotized in Chameleon's private clinic by the 9th Agency, which went on to hire her as a special psychology consultant. Ultimately, Chameleon was arrested on suspicion of having tampered with the Jacknal family's subconsciouses after they experienced auditory hallucinations that are sequela to hypnosis. Most importantly for her purposes, the dossier also details that since his discovery, the 9th Agency has held Oris hostage at an old agency depot on the border of [[[Eastside]]] and [[[the Rust]]]. When Chameleon receives this information, her voice disappears from the Chief's subconscious world. Struggling to escape the dream, the Chief recalls a suppressed memory: while hypnotized the first time, Chameleon implanted in them the urge to go to the 9th Agency's archives and investigate Oris's whereabouts, then forget having done it so that only she could recover the memory from their subconscious. When the Chief awakens from the dream, Chameleon has escaped. The Chief realizes that even with her pocket watch confiscated, Chameleon was still able to use her gold-rimmed glasses as a backup hypnosis prop.

Chameleon's power isn't just any hypnosis. She plants a subconscious thought in your mind that makes you want to check confidential documents, directly manipulating your behaviors and leading you to provide information to her without you realizing it. To retrieve Oris, the culprit who killed her family, from the 9th Agency, she is resorting to every possible measure. But the enemy that she has been fighting isn't you but the woman hiding in the dark. Having fallen victim to the hypnotist and become the pawn in her hands several times, you decide to never let this happen again.
interrogation3:
At the agency depot where Oris is being held hostage, the Chief meets with Chameleon one on one while an MBCC special operations team waits outside, ready to breach the building. Chameleon has tied Oris to a chair and left him in a semi-conscious state. Chameleon reveals that the secret which he murdered her parents to protect was infidelity, as he feared losing the protection of his then-fiancée's family. Having already taken away his wife, status and power with her machinations, Chameleon denies having done enough, saying that she has only made the people around him see who he really is -- she has not yet actually punished him at all. She says that she has not killed him nor run away because she wants an audience as she creates a tailor-made nightmare for him of an endless sea of fire and countless sharp blades. When the Chief expresses their shock at the torture, Chameleon is surprised that Langley did not tell him in the dream: despite all her credentials, the 9th Agency would not allow her near Oris because she is a psychopath who thrives on others' pain. The Chief attempts to end the torture by unleashing the Shackles, but the power fails to activate. The Chief believes that they are unresponsive because of previous subconscious impulses planted by Chameleon, but she reveals that from the second the Chief and their team approached the depot, all of them have once again been tricked into an illusory dream. The Chief fights through the hypnosis to draw a pistol given to them by Nightingale before they entered the depot. If they shoot at Chameleon, they hit her in the leg and break her concentration enough for the Chief to use the Shackles and force her to end Oris's nightmare. Despite this defeat, Chameleon is ecstatic to learn that, contrary to her belief, the Shackles can connect to the spiritual world. The Chief orders her to surrender, saying they don't want to hurt her any further, but Chameleon correctly denies this, saying that when they fired the gun, they had the intent to kill. Nightingale and the MBCC team enter the building, and the Chief orders her to return Oris to the 9th Agency and never report where he will be hidden. Chameleon says that although the Chief denies it, they wish that she would have killed the hostage, and that like with her the seeds of evil have been planted in their mind. If they shoot at themself, the pain from their leg wound snaps them awake enough to use the Shackles and force her to end Oris's nightmare. Defeated, Chameleon is incredulous that they would use such a method and says that they are no longer the novice who could be controlled so easily. Nightingale and the MBCC team enter the building and handcuff her. The Chief says Oris will be sent back to the 9th Agency and kept in a place that they will never know about, but Chameleon interrupts them, admitting her loss but saying that she already has a better toy to play with. Chameleon is brought back to the Bureau and placed under S-class surveillance. In the time since then, she has returned to playing the role of a psychologist and hasn't mentioned anything about Oris or her own psychopathy. Nevertheless, the Chief uneasily feels that their conflict with her has only just begun.

Oris is now a hostage secretly taken into custody by the 9th Agency. And Chameleon is cooperating with the MBCC to continue the detention. Perhaps it is just like what Chameleon said: this is a balancing act of restraint. But it is also acceptable if we continue this balance. Greed, desire, and pain... The seemingly cool-headed psychologist is actually struggling to hold down the impulses deep down. You only have one mission: maintain balance and contain the subject.
arrestRec1: Voluntarily waited at the private psychiatric clinic and actively cooperated with the MBCC. Suspected to have anticipated the arrest. With her encouragement and cooperation, the arrest went exceptionally well.
arrestRec2: Admitted to Banyan Medical College with distinction and stayed on as a teacher after graduation. Opened a private psychiatric clinic. Known as the most outstanding psychiatrist and hypnotherapist in DisCity and works as a psychological consultant for the intelligence agencies in secret.
arrestRec3: Both parents are reputable psychologists in Eastside, who were murdered fourteen years ago. The case was closed hastily after the clues were destroyed in a fire. Received a lot of attention from the community as a surviving orphan.
arrestRec4: Deliberately approached the family and friend of the Eastside Councilor, Oris, to manipulate them and turn them against Oris with hypnotic powers. It is reported that Oris did psychological counseling with Chameleon's parents fourteen years ago and is now being held in secret by the 9th Agency.
servingTerm1: The use of a pocket watch and gold-rimmed glasses reinforced her image as a psychiatrist to gain the patient's trust and enable smooth hypnosis. The lenses are not prescribed and no specific item is required for hypnosis.
servingTerm2: Occasionally summoned by the 9th Agency as a psychological consultant. Chameleon does not have a proactive attitude towards this and calls this "collaboration" "coercion". Even the FAC has no idea where she goes or does.
servingTerm3: Helps the Sinners in the Bureau with some psychological issues, but many Sinner remains scared of her, either by her name or by the hypnosis.
servingTerm4: Likes to chat with Chief late at night because Chief is one of the few who is not affected by her ability. She hopes to recover from her growing psychopathic issues from chatting with Chief.

baseVoicelines: [Obtain the Sinner] How brave of you to face me up close and personal... What if if I hypnotize you again, Chief? [Raise to Phase 1] Can't wait to fall into a deeper dream, can you? [Raise to Phase 3] I never knew such wonders existed beyond the bounds of knowledge... [Level Start] Now, whose pain will I uncover here? [Win Battles] The process was enjoyable. [Lose Battles] Occasional failures are essential for a balanced mind. [Ultimate Skill] Release... your power! [Die in Battles] This is the ending... I deserve... [Greeting] Hello, Dear Chief. If you have something on your mind, feel free to chat with me. How much do I charge? Oh, money is not what I want from you. [Conversation 1] Consciousness is a prison, and every one serves a life sentence in it. In the face of it, your Bureau is but a toy jail. [Conversation 2] Why psychology? Well, because it's an elegant, graceful science. I don't need any scalpels to kill you... I'm just kidding, don't be so tense. [Conversation 3] Tick, tock, tick, tock... Life is like the pendulum of a clock, constantly swinging between pain and weariness. [Special Conversation 1] Every night, quite a few Sinners are plagued by nightmares. I'd like to talk to them, individually and privately. I hope you won't mind? [Special Conversation 2] The beast deep in our consciousness will be roused one day. When the time comes, will you be able to subdue it, or will you get devoured by it, till there's nothing left of you? I look forward to finding out. [Special Conversation 3] The so-called mercy from others is like a flock of vultures. When an atrocity happens, they circle above your head, screeching and squeaking. Only when the victim stops struggling will they land, and scavenge for the last bits of bloody flesh. [Full Compliance] The most stubborn patient and the most ruthless psychologist——don't we make the perfect pair? [Idle] Look at the pocket watch. Relax, relax. You'll begin to feel sleepy... and sleepier... Tell me, what did you see in your dreams? [Annoyed] I know what you're thinking about... No subconscious impulses go unnoticed before my eyes. [Special Attention] Oh, here comes the patient I've been expecting. Shall we begin? [Dispatch] This is not the job of a psychologist... Sigh. [Dispatch Complete] I've seen some interesting things on the way. Wanna hear my stories? [Level Up] Look, the abyss is even closer now.
attireVoicelines1: [Attire Obtained] "Knowledge", "greed", "love"... Seduced by them, you have finally come to see me. [Greeting] I can answer all your questions, but one answer begets another... tell me, who are you? [Ordinary Contact 1] You won't be able to see the answer clearly at such a distance. Come closer... [Ordinary Contact 2] To use the sun and moon gods as totem decorations... is this piety or arrogance? Human nature is interesting, precisely because of its contradictions, is it not? [Idle] Don't rush to wake up. We are the only ones in the Temple of Dreams. [Annoyed] What, do I have the answer you want hidden on me? If it can really help you, please feel free to explore... [Special Attention] "Know thyself"—a seemingly simple riddle, yet it has stumped generations of brave warriors, and now... it's finally your turn. [Level Up} Man is driven by desire, and desire is inherently boundless.
attireVoicelines2:
[Attire Obtained]
You followed the guidance of dreams to my realm. Are you here to break the shackles in your heart?

[Greeting]
The cruelty of the real world always catches people off guard, so why not stay here and wallow in this beautiful moment with me?

[Ordinary Contact 1]
What you see with your eyes may not necessarily be the truth.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Tell me, is it more unfortunate to never wake up from a dream or to never dream?

[Ordinary Contact 3]
Here, I can take you back to the past and make up for those unforgettable regrets... Will you abandon yourself to the dream eternally?

[Ordinary Contact 4]
Want your dream to come true instantly? It's simple, just stop the time at the moment you make your wish to me, and make it flow again when your dream is achieved. Brilliant, isn't it?

[Idle] 
People are obsessed with interpreting dreams. They always try to recreate their dreams in reality, even the unpleasant ones...

[Special Attention] 
Dreams express the deepest desires in a person's heart. Let's see, what do you desire?

[Level Up}
Ah, what a wonderful dream.

[Pat Head]
Some say life is a dream, because everything emerges and perishes on a term that mortals have no control over. One day, you might wake up and realize that the life you've lived through was just a doze on a sunny afternoon.

++* ⚠⚠ Secret Guest

//Chameleon entered the office without permission.//

**System Notifications:** Chief, the office door has been unlocked. Watch yourself.

**Chief:** Chameleon, who let you into this office?

**Chameleon:** The security guards "willingly" opened the door for me.

**Chief:** So you hypnotized the guards again...

**Chameleon:** I just wanted to see what has been keeping you so busy, Chief. You look nervous. Are you...

**Chameleon:** Are you doing something that you don't want others to know?

* **Prompt:** Out...
* **Prompt:** This has nothing to do with you.

**Chameleon:** Well, well, well, are you blushing, Chief?

**Chameleon:** It's okay. I have already predicted your every move.

**Chameleon:** I've seen everything about you.

**Chameleon:** When you were hypnotized.
supervision6:
++* ⚠⚠⚠ Master of Hypnosis

//Chameleon demonstrates to you her hypnosis skills.//

**Chameleon:** Kids who don't behave will never wake up.

**System Notifications:** Chameleon puts her pocket watch away and taps on your nose lightly with her finger.

* **Prompt:** What did you say?

**Chameleon:** Chief, you asked me to demonstrate my hypnosis skills just now.

**Chameleon:** As you wish, you're in a dream now.

* **Prompt:** That's not possible.

**Chief:** A dream doesn't feel so real.

**Chameleon:** Oh, really? Many of my patients that I hypnotized say that too.

**Chameleon:** See for yourself whether you're in a dream or not.

**System Notifications:** You look at the surroundings. Everything seems so real, but somehow you feel a little uneasy.

**Chief:** Wake me up, please.

**Chameleon:** Haha, you're indeed very smart, Chief. You realized you were in a dream sooner than most other patients.

**Chameleon:** Alright, alright. As long as you do what I say, you can escape this dream.

**Chameleon:** Now, repeat after me: "Passing through countless cages, I'm a bird that only belongs to you."

* **Prompt:** Repeat after her
 * **Chameleon:** See, you're already awake.
 * **System Notifications:** You find yourself lying on the hypnosis chair. Chameleon is sitting on the desk's corner, looking into your eyes with a smile.

* **Prompt:** Not repeat after her
 * //[Selecting this prompt will cause the supervision event to reset. This continues until "Repeat after her" is chosen]//

voicelines.Conversation 1 - EN: Consciousness is a prison, and every one serves a life sentence in it. In the face of it, your Bureau is but a toy jail.
voicelines.Conversation 1 - JP: 意識という檻に、すべての人は幽閉され、逃れることは一生できないの。 ふふ、だからその檻の前では、あなたの管理局だって幽閉ゲームをしているにすぎないのよ。
voicelines.Conversation 1 - KR: 의식이라는 감옥은 모든 사람을 영원히 가두어 놓죠. 의식 앞에서는 당신의 관리국도 감옥 놀이에 불과해요.
voicelines.Conversation 1 - CN: 意识这座牢笼，将所有人幽禁，终生无法逃脱。在它面前，您的管理局不过是一场监禁游戏而已。
voicelines.Conversation 1 - TW: 意識這座牢籠，將所有人幽禁，終生無法逃脫。在它面前，您的管理局不過是一場監禁遊戲而已。
voicelines.Conversation 2 - EN: Why psychology? Well, because it's an elegant, graceful science. I don't need any scalpels to kill you... I'm just kidding, don't be so tense.
voicelines.Conversation 2 - JP: なぜ心理学を選んだのか？優雅で余裕のある科学だからよ。メスを持たなくても、あなたを殺せるから……ふふ、冗談よ。そう緊張しないで？
voicelines.Conversation 2 - KR: 제가 왜 심리학을 선택했냐고요? 심리학은 우아한 학문이기 때문이죠. 굳이 칼을 댈 필요도 없이… 당신을 죽일 수 있으니까요… 농담이니까 긴장하지 마세요.
voicelines.Conversation 2 - CN: 为什么选择心理学？因为它是一门优雅从容的科学，我不需要借助工具，就能了解你的全部……开玩笑的，不用那么紧张。
voicelines.Conversation 2 - TW: 為什麼選擇心理學？因為它是一門優雅從容的科學，我不需要手術刀，就能殺死你......開玩笑的，不用那麼緊張。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - EN: Tick, tock, tick, tock... Life is like the pendulum of a clock, constantly swinging between pain and weariness.
voicelines.Conversation 3 - JP: チクタク、チクタク、チクタク……人生は振り子のように、いつまでも苦痛と倦怠の間を揺れ動いているのよ……。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - KR: 똑, 딱, 똑, 딱… 인생은 이 시계 추처럼 고통과 권태 사이를 영원히 오가죠.
voicelines.Conversation 3 - CN: 滴，答，滴，答……人生就像这钟摆，永远在痛苦和倦怠之间摆动。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - TW: 滴，答，滴，答……人生就像這鐘擺，永遠在痛苦和倦怠之間擺動。
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - EN: Every night, quite a few Sinners are plagued by nightmares. I'd like to talk to them, individually and privately. I hope you won't mind?
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - JP: 夜になるとね、ナイトメアに襲われるコンビクトがたくさんいるの。ねぇ、局長さん。彼らと二人きりでプライベートな話がしたいのだけど……気にしないわよね？
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - KR: 깊은 밤이 찾아오면 수많은 수감자들이 악몽에 빠져들죠. 제가 개인적으로 이들을 만나봐도 괜찮겠죠?
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - CN: 每到深夜就会有不少禁闭者被噩梦侵扰，我想私下找他们单独聊聊，局长您应该不会介意吧？
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - TW: 每到深夜就會有不少禁閉者被惡夢侵擾，我想私下找他們單獨聊聊，局長您應該不會介意吧？
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - EN: The beast deep in our consciousness will be roused one day. When the time comes, will you be able to subdue it, or will you get devoured by it, till there's nothing left of you? I look forward to finding out.
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - JP: 無意識に潜む猛獣はいつか目を覚ますわ。その時の局長が、それをうまく抑え込めるかしら？……それとも一口ずつ飲み込んでいくの？とても楽しみだわ。
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - KR: 어느 날 의식 깊은 곳의 야수가 깨어난다면 국장님은 녀석을 사로잡을까요, 아니면 비참하게 잡아먹힐까요? 정말 기대되네요.
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - CN: 意识深处的猛兽总有一天会醒来，那时的局长，是成功掌控了它，还是被它一口一口吞噬殆尽呢？我非常期待。
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - TW: 意識深處的猛獸總有一天會醒來，那時的局長，是成功掌控了它，還是被它一口一口吞噬殆盡呢？我非常期待。
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - EN: The so-called mercy from others is like a flock of vultures. When an atrocity happens, they circle above your head, screeching and squeaking. Only when the victim stops struggling will they land, and scavenge for the last bits of bloody flesh.
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - JP: 他人の善意は、まるでハゲタカのようなものよ。暴行が起こると、頭上を旋回して耳障りな音を立てるだけで、被害者がもがくのをやめると、地面に落りてきて最後の肉を貪り喰らうのよ。
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - KR: 타인의 이익은 마치 독수리와도 같아요. 다툼이 일어났을 때는 그저 날카로운 소리를 지르며 머리 위를 맴돌고, 피해자의 몸부림이 끝난 뒤에야 바닥에 내려앉아 남은 살코기를 음미하죠.
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - CN: 这座城市里，处处是为了自己的利益罔顾其他性命的人。有时候我会担心，像你这样的异类，真的能在这里活下去吗……
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - TW: 他人的公益，就像禿鷲一樣，暴行發生的時候，只會盤旋在你的頭頂，發出聒噪刺耳的聲響，等受害者停止了掙扎，才會落在地上，分食最後一點血肉。
voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: The most stubborn patient and the most ruthless psychologist—don't we make the perfect pair?
voicelines.Full Compliance - JP: 最も頑固な精神病患者と最も残酷な臨床心理士——わたしたちの間には世界で最も完璧な関係が築かれているようね。
voicelines.Full Compliance - KR: 가장 고질적인 정신질환자가, 가장 잔혹한 정신과 의사를 만났다…? 우리 사이야말로 가장 완벽한 의료진과 환자의 관계지.
voicelines.Full Compliance - CN: 最顽固的精神病患，遇上最残酷的心理医生——我们之间有世上最完美的医患关系。
voicelines.Full Compliance - TW: 最頑固的精神病患，遇上最殘酷的心理醫生——我們之間有世上最完美的醫患關係。
voicelines.Idle - EN: Look at the pocket watch. Relax, relax. You'll begin to feel sleepy... and sleepier... Tell me, what did you see in your dreams?
voicelines.Idle - JP: この懐中時計を見て、リラックスしてちょうだい。あなたはだんだん眠くなる……眠くなる……さぁ教えて。あなたは夢の中で何を見たのかしら？
voicelines.Idle - KR: 자, 이 회중시계를 바라보세요. 긴장을 풀고… 릴랙스, 릴랙스. 점점 잠이 옵니다… 꿈속에서 무엇을 보았나요?
voicelines.Idle - CN: 看着怀表，放松，放松。你会渐渐变困…变困……告诉我，你在梦中看见了什么？
voicelines.Idle - TW: 看著懷錶、放鬆、放鬆。你會漸漸變睏…變睏……告訴我，你在夢中看見了什麼？
voicelines.Annoyed - EN: I know what you're thinking about... No subconscious impulses go unnoticed before my eyes.
voicelines.Annoyed - JP: ふふふ。何を考えているのかわかってるわ……どんな無意識の衝動も、わたしの目をごまかすことはできないのよ。
voicelines.Annoyed - KR: 하하, 무슨 생각을 하는지 알겠네요… 충동적인 잠재의식이라도, 제 눈을 피해 갈 수는 없답니다.
voicelines.Annoyed - CN: 呵呵，我知道你在想什么……任何潜意识的冲动，都瞒不过我的眼睛。
voicelines.Annoyed - TW: 呵呵，我知道你在想什麼……任何潛意識的衝動，都瞞不過我的眼睛。
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: Oh, here comes the patient I've been expecting. Shall we begin?
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: あらあらあら、予約の患者さんが来たみたいね。では始めましょうか。
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 오호, 예약한 환자가 왔군요. 그럼 시작해 볼까요.
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: ohho，看来预约好的病人来了，那我们开始吧。
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 啊哈，看來預約好的病人來了，那我們開始吧。
voicelines.Dispatch - EN: This is not the job of a psychologist... Sigh.
voicelines.Dispatch - JP: 臨床心理士にこんなことをさせるなんて…… はぁ……
voicelines.Dispatch - CN: 居然让心理医生做这些……
voicelines.Dispatch - TW: 居然讓心理醫生做這些……
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - EN: I've seen some interesting things on the way. Wanna hear my stories?
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - JP: 向こうで面白いことがあったの。聞きたい？
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - KR: 오는 길에 흥미로운 일이 있었는데… 들어 볼래요? 국장님?
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - CN: 路上遇到了一些有趣的事，局长想听听吗？
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - TW: 路上遇到了一些有趣的事，局長想聽聽嗎？
voicelines.Level Up - EN: Look, the abyss is even closer now...
voicelines.Level Up - JP: これで、より深淵に近づけたわ……。

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: "Knowledge," "greed," "love"... Seduced by them, you have finally come to see me.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - JP: 「好奇心」「強欲」「愛」……これらに導かれて、わたしに会いに来たのね。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - KR: 지식', '탐욕', '사랑'… 이런 것들에 이끌려, 당신은 결국 날 만나러 왔군요.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - CN: 「求知」、「贪婪」、「爱」……你被它们引诱着，终于，来见我了。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - TW: 「求知」、「貪婪」、「愛」……你被它們引誘著，終於，來見我了。
voicelines.Greeting - EN: I can answer all your questions, but one answer begets another... tell me, who are you?
voicelines.Greeting - JP: わたしはあなたの疑問に全て答えてあげられる。でも、「答え」が欲しければ「答え」をちょうだいー「あなた」は誰なのか、教えてくれる？
voicelines.Greeting - KR: 난 당신의 모든 문제에 해답을 줄 수 있어요. 하지만, '해답'은 또 다른 '해답'으로 교환해야 하죠… 자, 말해줘요. '당신'은 누구죠?
voicelines.Greeting - CN: 我可以解答你的所有困惑，但「答案」需要用另一个「答案」交换——告诉我，“你”是谁？
voicelines.Greeting - TW: 我可以解答你的所有困惑，但「答案」需要用另一個「答案」交換——告訴我，「你」是誰？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: You won't be able to see the answer clearly at such a distance. Come closer...
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - JP: この距離では、謎は解けないわ。さぁ、もっと近づいて……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - KR: 지금 이 거리는, 수수께끼의 진실을 풀어내기 어렵답니다. 이리와요, 더 가까이~
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - CN: 现在的距离，可是很难看清谜底的。过来，再靠近一点~
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - TW: 現在的距離，可是很難看清謎底的。過來，再靠近一點~
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - EN: To use the sun and moon gods as totem decorations... is this piety or arrogance? Human nature is interesting precisely because of its contradictions, is it not?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - JP: 太陽と月の神を飾りつけるなんて、敬虔なのか傲慢なのか……人間は矛盾しているからこそ面白いのだけれどね。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - KR: 판테온을 토템 장식으로 한다는 건… 경건함일까 오만함일까… 인간성이란, 이런 모순이 존재하기에 재밌는 것 아닐까요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - CN: 以日月神灵作为图腾装饰，这究竟是虔诚还是傲慢呢……人性正因为矛盾才有趣，不是吗？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - TW: 以日月神靈作為圖騰裝飾，這究竟是虔誠還是傲慢呢……人性正因為矛盾才有趣，不是嗎？
voicelines.Idle - EN: Don't rush to wake up. We are the only ones in the Temple of Dreams.
voicelines.Idle - JP: 目覚めるにはまだ早いわ。この夢の神殿にいるのは、わたしたち二人だけ。
voicelines.Idle - KR: 급히 깨어날 필요 없어요, 꿈결의 신전에는 나와 당신 둘 뿐이에요.
voicelines.Idle - CN: 不用着急醒来，梦境神殿中，只有你我。
voicelines.Idle - TW: 不用著急醒來，夢境神殿中，只有你我。
voicelines.Annoyed - EN: What, do I have the answer you want hidden on me? If it can really help you, please feel free to explore...
voicelines.Annoyed - JP: あなたの欲しがっている答えがここに隠れているの？これで閃きが得られるなら、思うがままに探してみて。
voicelines.Annoyed - KR: 왜요, 나에게 당신이 원하는 답이 숨어 있나요? 만약 정말로 내가 깨우침을 줄 수 있다면, 마음껏 탐색해 봐요~
voicelines.Annoyed - CN: 怎么，我的身上藏有你想要的答案吗？如果真的能给你启迪，就请尽情探索吧~
voicelines.Annoyed - TW: 怎麼，我的身上藏有你想要的答案嗎？如果真的能給你啟迪，就請盡情探索吧~
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: "Know thyself"—a seemingly simple riddle, yet it has stumped generations of brave warriors, and now... it's finally your turn.
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: 「汝自身を知れ」——一見簡単そうでも、数々の人間がここで躓いてきたの。そして今……あなたの番がやってきたわ。
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 나 자신을 알아가는 것.' …간단한 문제 같지만, 무수히 많은 세대의 용사들이 헤어나오지 못했죠. 이제... 드디어 당신 차례예요.
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: “认识自己”——看似简单的谜题，却困住了一代又一代勇者，现在……终于轮到你了。
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 「認識自己」——看似簡單的謎題，卻困住了一代又一代勇者，現在……終於輪到你了。
voicelines.Level Up - EN: Man is driven by desire, and desire is inherently boundless.
voicelines.Level Up - JP: 人とは「強欲の自我」。そして、欲望が尽きることはない。
voicelines.Level Up - KR: 인간은 탐욕 그 자체. 그러나 탐욕은 본래 끝이 없는 것.
voicelines.Level Up - CN: 人是“贪欲之我”，而欲望，本就没有尽头。
voicelines.Level Up - TW: 人是「貪欲之我」，而欲望，本就沒有盡頭。

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: You followed the guidance of dreams to my realm. Are you here to break the shackles in your heart?
voicelines.Attire Obtained - JP: 夢の導きに従い、心の束縛を解くためにここに来たのかしら？
voicelines.Attire Obtained - KR: 꿈이 이끄는 대로, 마음의 속박에서 벗어나기 위해 이곳에 왔나요?
voicelines.Attire Obtained - CN: 遵循梦的指引来到此处，你是来破解心中的桎梏么？
voicelines.Attire Obtained - TW: 遵循夢的指引來到此處，你是來破解心中的桎梏嗎？
voicelines.Greeting - EN: The cruelty of the real world always catches people off guard, so why not stay here and wallow in this beautiful moment with me?
voicelines.Greeting - JP: 現実世界の残酷さは、常に人間の不意をつくものよ。だからこそ、ここに留まってわたしとこの最高の瞬間を共有した方がよくないかしら？
voicelines.Greeting - KR: 현실 세계의 잔혹함은 우리가 어떻게 할 수 있는 게 아니잖아요? 그럼 그냥 여기서 저와 함께 가장 아름다운 순간을 즐기는 건 어때요?
voicelines.Greeting - CN: 真实世界的残酷总会让人措手不及，那何不留在这里，和我一起共享这最美好的瞬间？
voicelines.Greeting - TW: 真實世界的殘酷總會讓人措手不及，那何不留在這裡，和我一起共享這最美好的瞬間？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: What you see with your eyes may not necessarily be the truth.
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - JP: あなたの目に見えているものが真実とは限らないわ。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - KR: 눈에 보이는 게 모두 진실은 아니에요.
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - CN: 你用眼睛看到的，未必就是真实。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - TW: 你用眼睛看到的，未必就是真實。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - EN: Tell me, is it more unfortunate to never wake up from a dream or to never dream?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - JP: 夢から覚めることができないのと、夢を見ることができないのとでは、どちらが不幸だと思う？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - KR: 영원히 꿈에서 깨어나지 않는 것과 영원히 꿈을 꿀 수 없는 것 중 어느 쪽이 더 불행하죠?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - CN: 你说，永远不能从梦中醒来和永远也看不到梦，哪个更为不幸？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - TW: 你說，永遠不能從夢中醒來和永遠也看不到夢，哪個更為不幸？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - EN: Here, I can take you back to the past and make up for those unforgettable regrets... Will you abandon yourself to the dream eternally?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - JP: ここはあなたを過去に連れ戻し、忘れられない後悔を埋めてくれる場所 ……あなたは永遠にこの中で溺れていたい？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - KR: 여기선 당신을 과거로 데려가 잊을 수 없는 아쉬움을 채워줄 수 있어요… 어때요? 이곳에 영원히 있고 싶지 않나요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - CN: 这里能带你回到过去，弥补那些难以忘怀的遗憾……你愿意永溺其中吗？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - TW: 這裡能帶你回到過去，彌補那些難以忘懷的遺憾……你願意永溺其中嗎？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - EN: Want your dream to come true instantly? It's simple, just stop the time at the moment you make your wish to me, and make it flow again when your dream is achieved. Brilliant, isn't it?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - JP: 夢を叶えたい？簡単なことよ。わたしに願ったその瞬間で時間を止め、夢が叶った時点で再び流れ始めるようにすれば、あなたの夢は叶うわ……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - KR: 꿈을 이루고 싶나요? 그건 어렵지 않아요. 당신이 내게 바라는 그 순간에 시간을 멈춘 다음, 꿈이 이루어질 때 시간을 다시 흐르게 한다면 꿈은 현실이 되어있겠죠…
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - CN: 要美梦成真？很简单，只要让时间停在你对我祈望的那一刻，直到梦想达成之时再开始流转，你的美梦便能实现……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - TW: 要美夢成真？很簡單，只要讓時間停在你對我祈望的那一刻，直到夢想達成之時再開始流轉，你的美夢便能實現……
voicelines.Idle - EN: People are obsessed with interpreting dreams. They always try to recreate their dreams in reality, even the unpleasant ones...
voicelines.Idle - JP: 人々は夢占いに熱中して、夢の中で起きたことを現実で再現したいと常に思っている。たとえそれが楽しいものではなくとも……
voicelines.Idle - KR: 사람들은 꿈으로 점치는 걸 좋아하죠. 꿈에서 일어난 일이 현실에서 그대로 재현되길 바라기도 해요. 설령 그게 유쾌한 꿈이 아닐지라도 말이죠…
voicelines.Idle - CN: 人们对卜梦乐此不疲，总想要将梦中发生的事情在现实中完全还原出来，哪怕这段梦中记忆并不愉快……
voicelines.Idle - TW: 人們對卜夢樂此不疲，總想要將夢中發生的事情在現實中完全還原出來，哪怕這段夢中記憶並不愉快……
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: Dreams express the deepest desires in a person's heart. Let's see, what do you desire?
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: 夢は人の心の奥底にある望みを表すもの。あなたがどんな願望を持っているのか見せてちょうだい。
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 꿈은 인간의 마음속 가장 근원적인 갈망을 표현하죠. 당신에겐 어떤 바람이 있는지 한번 들여다볼까요?
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: 梦境表达的是人内心深处最本源的渴求，让我看一看，你有着怎样的愿望。
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 夢境表達的是人內心深處最本源的渴求，讓我看一看，你有著怎樣的願望。
voicelines.Level Up - JP: う～ん、なんていい夢なの。
voicelines.Pat Head - EN: Some say life is a dream, because everything emerges and perishes on a term that mortals have no control over. One day, you might wake up and realize that the life you've lived through was just a doze on a sunny afternoon.
voicelines.Pat Head - JP: 人生は夢のようなものであり、万物は夢のために生まれては消えていくと言われているわ。いわゆる滄海桑田は、目が覚めた瞬間にほんの一瞬の出来事だと気付くのよ。
voicelines.Pat Head - KR: 인생은 꿈과 같고, 모든 일들은 꿈에서 비롯되고 꿈속으로 귀결된다고 하죠. 세월의 변화도 꿈에서 깨어나 보면 찰나에 불과하죠.
voicelines.Pat Head - CN: 都说人生如梦，万事皆因梦而生，也因梦而灭。所谓沧海桑田，在清醒的瞬间才意识到不过是须臾弹指之间。
voicelines.Pat Head - TW: 都說人生如夢，萬事皆因夢而生，也因夢而滅。所謂滄海桑田，在清醒的瞬間才意識到不過是須臾彈指之間。
